intro: [WRONG START] Embilia tsjeriam-cottam, commonly known as the Malabar embelia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive fragrance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth.
